content: I've been making kimchi at home for a while now, and I really enjoy the process. I've tried a few different recipes, but I usually stick to a classic baechu kimchi recipe with napa cabbage, Korean chili flakes, garlic, ginger, and fish sauce. I like my kimchi to be pretty spicy, so I add a generous amount of gochugaru. I've also experimented with adding other ingredients like carrots, cucumbers, and scallions to give it some extra flavor and texture. Do you have any recommendations for other kimchi recipes or ingredients I could try?
